channel.title: dotnetkicks.com
channel.description: The latest published stories from DotNetKicks.com

item.title: Critter Stack Workshop at DevUp Next Week
item.description: If you're planning on coming to my workshop, you'll want .NET 8, Git, and some kind of Docker Desktop on your box to run the sample code I'll use in the workshop. If Docker doesn't work for you, you maybe want a local install of PostgreSQL and Rabbit MQ.

item.title: Tales from the .NET Migration Trenches - Middleware
item.description: Posts in this series: * Intro * Cataloging * Empty Proxy * Shared Library * Our First Controller * Migrating Initial Business Logic * Our First Views * Session State * Hangfire * Authentication * Middleware In the last post, we looked at tackling probably the most important pieces of middleware - authentication.

item.title: Tales from the .NET Migration Trenches - Middleware
item.description: Posts in this series: * Intro * Cataloging * Empty Proxy * Shared Library * Our First Controller * Migrating Initial Business Logic * Our First Views * Session State * Hangfire * Authentication * Middleware In the last post, we looked at tackling probably the most important pieces of middleware - authentication.

item.title: Simplifying [Theory] test data with Xunit.Combinatorial
item.description: In this post I show how you can simplify your xUnit [Theory] tests using the Xunit.Combinatorial package to auto-generate your test parameters

item.title: Introducing the revamped Attach to Process experience - Visual Studio Blog
item.description: Discover the new Attach to Process dialog in Visual Studio 2022! Experience a refreshed UI, improved performance, enhanced search capabilities, and better theming support. Debug processes more efficiently on both local and remote machines with these exciting updates.

item.title: The Best Tool for Real Content Attribution? The Fermi Problem
item.description: I was recently scrolling through LinkedIn, admiring the art of the single-line hook followed by emoji bullets, when I stumbled on a really interesting question from Fio Dossetto. item.description: MLOps, or Machine Learning Operations, is like the backbone of a well-oiled machine in the machine learning domain. It's an intersection where machine

item.title: Data Anomaly Detection Using LightGBM
item.description: Dr. James McCaffrey from Microsoft Research presents a complete program that uses the Python language LightGBM system to create a custom autoencoder for data anomaly detection. You can easily adapt the demo program for your own anomaly detection scenarios.

item.title: The Singleton pattern in modern C# is not your dad's one!
item.description: The Singleton pattern in modern C# is not your dad's one! How did this classic evolve to the era of unit testing and dependency injection? And how to ensure that there is _really_ just one Singleton instance in your code?

item.description: Chances are you or your manager thinks you're doing DevOps. But what if you're doing it wrong? Do you really know what DevOps is? After all, you have a DevOps

item.description: A 70+ journey into fixing a ~10 year old Akka.NET bug.

item.title: Critter Stack Roadmap for the Rest of 2024
item.description: It's been a little bit since I've written any kind of update on the unofficial "Critter Stack" roadmap, with the last update in February. A ton of new, important strategic features have been added to especially Marten since then, with plenty of expansion of Wolverine to boot.

item.title: .NET 6: Don’t Panic Yet - But .NET 6 End of Support Is On The Horizon
item.description: .NET 6 end of support is Nov. 12, 2024! Don't panic, but it's time to plan your upgrade to .NET 8. This will ensure continued security patches, tech support, and compatibility with the latest tools and libraries. Microsoft's .NET Upgrade Assistant can help, but be prepared for some manual work.

item.title: Creating source-only NuGet packages
item.description: In this post I show how you can create a NuGet package that contains source code (instead of dlls) which is then compiled into the target project

item.title: Making Marten Faster Through Table Partitioning
item.description: There's been a definite theme lately about increasing the performance and scalability of Marten, as evident (I hope) in my post last week describing new optimization options in Marten 7.25. Today I was able to push a follow up feature that got missed in that release that allows Marten users to utilize PostgreSQL table partitioning...

item.title: Easily Create Bindings for .NET MAUI with Native Library Interop - .NET Blog
item.description: Learn how to get started creating bindings with Native Library Interop by following this example binding native Chart libraries in a .NET MAUI application.

item.title: Sign VSIX packages with Sign CLI - Visual Studio Blog
item.description: You can now leverage Sign CLI for a more secure, modern way to sign your Visual Studio extensions. Signing your VSIX packages improves security, prevents tampering, and builds trust with your users. This integration makes it easier and more convenient to sign your packages than ever before!

item.title: The Memento Design Pattern in C#, Practically With Examples [2024]
item.description: The Memento pattern is one of the foundational design patterns. It helps build UI features like undo/redo or UI transactions. In this article, we will see how to implement the Memento pattern in C#. We use a small WPF-based Fish Tank Manager as a sample application.

item.title: Marten 7.25 is Better, Faster, Stronger
item.description: Just a reminder, JasperFx Software offers support contracts and consulting services to help you get the most out of the "Critter Stack" tools (Marten and Wolverine). If you're building server side applications on .NET, the Critter Stack is the most feature rich tool set for Event Sourcing and Event Driven Architectures around.

item.title: How use a Blazor QuickGrid with GraphQL - .NET Blog
item.description: In this is the second post in a series of posts about GraphQL and .NET, we will see how to fill a Blazor QuickGrid component with data fetched with GraphQL. We will also use the virtualize feature of the QuickGrid to improve performance.
